elements.title: Oriana Skylar Mastro (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Oriana Skylar Mastro (pictured), a Stanford political scientist, joined the U.S. Air Force as a PhD student to better understand military issues in the Asia–Pacific region?

elements.title: mixed 4 × 400 metres relay at the 2024 World Athletics Relays (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the championship record was broken three times in the mixed 4 × 400 metres relay at the 2024 World Athletics Relays?

elements.title: Anderson's Grocery (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in its centennial year, Anderson's Grocery was said to be one of only ten small U.S. groceries that were more than a hundred years old?

elements.title: Mikaella Moshe (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Israeli archer Mikaella Moshe competed in the 2024 Paris Olympics after having spent less than two years in the sport?

elements.title: a third of London Underground stations have step-free access (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a third of London Underground stations have step-free access?

elements.title: Filomenaleonisa Iakopo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Olympic sprinter Filomenaleonisa Iakopo is also a competitive bodybuilder?

elements.title: Idaho State Veterans Cemetery (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Idaho State Veterans Cemetery faced criticism in 2014 when it did not allow a lesbian couple to be buried together?

elements.title: longest story (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that three-quarters of Doctor Who's longest story are missing?

elements.title: Apsara Sakbun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that had Cambodian swimmer Apsara Sakbun declined her invitation to compete at the 2024 Summer Olympics, her sister would have become an Olympian instead?
